CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As shown in Table 1 , when the active layer was PSFDTBT / PC71BM in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , the highest PCE of 4.6% with a V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm , and an FF of 0.60 was achieved.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |

In the given paragraph, the two "Material Name" entities are "PSFDTBT" and "PC71BM". These are materials used in the active layer of a device, as mentioned in the context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |

In the given paragraph, the two "Material Name" entities are "PSFDTBT" and "PC71BM". These are the only materials clearly referred to in the context. The other terms, such as "Table 1", "weight ratio", "1 : 3", "PCE", "V oc", "J sc", and "FF" are not materials, so they have been removed from the table.

Paragraph: As shown in Table 1, when the active layer was PSFDTBT/PC71BM in a weight ratio of 1:3, the highest PCE of 4.6% with a Voc of 0.94 V, a Jsc of 8.0 mA/cm, and an FF of 0.60 was achieved.

After re-evaluating the paragraph, I have determined that all the mentioned properties refer to material properties. Here is the updated table:

Property Name
---
PCE
Voc
Jsc
FF

These properties are commonly used to describe the performance of organic solar cells, and they stand for Power Conversion Efficiency, Open-Circuit Voltage, Short-Circuit Current Density, and Fill Factor, respectively.
